column1: If Stage I is abnormal, Stage II may be done 3 to 7 days later.
Intrinsic factor is a protein produced by cells in the stomach lining.

Other conditions for which the test may be performed: - Anemia of B12 deficiency - Condition in which digested food slows or stops moving through part of the intestines (blind loop syndrome) - Megaloblastic anemia
Stages I and II will be abnormal in people who have problems absorbing vitamin B12 and intrinsic factor in the small intestine.
